items.title: Awesome Graphql
items.content_text:
### Specifications

*   [GraphQL (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-spec) - Working draft of the specification for GraphQL.
*   [GraphQL over HTTP (‚≠ê414)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-over-http) - Working draft of "GraphQL over HTTP" specification.
*   [GraphQL Relay](https://relay.dev/docs/guides/graphql-server-specification/) - Relay-compliant GraphQL server specification.
*   [OpenCRUD (‚≠ê388)](https://github.com/opencrud/opencrud) - OpenCRUD is a GraphQL CRUD API specification for databases.

### Foundations

*   [GraphQL Foundation](https://graphql.org/foundation/) - GraphQL Foundation under the Linux Foundation

### Communities

*   [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/795330550572866/) - Group for discussions, articles and knowledge sharing.
*   [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/graphql) - Questions and answers. Use the tag `graphql`.
*   [GraphQL APIs (‚≠ê4.6k)](https://github.com/APIs-guru/graphql-apis) - A collective list of public GraphQL APIs.

### Meetups

*   [Relay Meetup](https://relaymeetup.com/) - A global, online meetup on Relay, the GraphQL client.
*   [Amsterdam](https://www.meetup.com/Amsterdam-GraphQL-Meetup/)
*   [Bangalore](https://www.meetup.com/graphql-bangalore/)
*   [Berlin](https://www.meetup.com/graphql-berlin/)
*   [Buenos Aires](https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/GraphQL-BA/)
*   [Copenhagen](https://www.meetup.com/Copenhagen-GraphQL-Meetup-Group/)
*   [Dallas-Fort Worth](https://www.meetup.com/DFW-GraphQL-Meetup/)
*   [Hamburg](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Hamburg/)
*   [London](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-London/)
*   [Melbourne](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Melbourne/)
*   [Munich](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Munich/)
*   [New York City](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-NYC/)
*   [San Francisco](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-SF/)
*   [Seattle](https://www.meetup.com/Seattle-GraphQL/)
*   [Sydney](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Sydney/)
*   [Tel Aviv](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-TLV/)
*   [Wroc≈Çaw](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Wroclaw/)
*   [Singapore](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-SG/)
*   [Zurich](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Zurich/)

### JavaScript/TypeScript

*   [graphql-js (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js) - A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript.
*   [graphql-jit (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/zalando-incubator/graphql-jit) - GraphQL execution using a JIT compiler.

### Clients

*   [apollo-client (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for every UI framework and GraphQL server.
*   [graphql-request (‚≠ê6k)](https://github.com/prisma-labs/graphql-request) - A minimal GraphQL client for Node and browsers.
*   [typescript-graphql-request](https://graphql-code-generator.com/docs/plugins/typescript-graphql-request) - Use GraphQL Request as a fully typed SDK.
*   [graphql-zeus (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/graphql-editor/graphql-zeus) - GraphQL Zeus creates autocomplete client library for `JavaScript` or `TypeScript` which provides autocompletion for strongly typed queries.
*   [graphqurl (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/hasura/graphqurl) - curl for GraphQL with autocomplete, subscriptions and GraphiQL. Also a dead-simple universal javascript GraphQL client.
*   [aws-amplify (‚≠ê9.5k)](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js) - A client library developed by Amazon for caching, analytics and more that includes a way to fetch GraphQL queries.

### Frontend Framework Integrations

*   [vue-apollo (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-apollo) - Apollo/GraphQL integration for VueJS.
*   [apollo-angular (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for Angular and every GraphQL server.
*   [svelte-apollo (‚≠ê949)](https://github.com/timhall/svelte-apollo) - Svelte integration for Apollo GraphQL.
*   [ember-apollo-client (‚≠ê280)](https://github.com/ember-graphql/ember-apollo-client) - An ember-cli addon for Apollo Client and GraphQL.
*   [apollo-elements (‚≠ê420)](https://github.com/apollo-elements/apollo-elements) - GraphQL web components that work in any frontend framework.

### Frontend Framework Integrations / React

*   [react-apollo](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/) - The core @apollo/client library provides built-in integration with React.
*   [relay (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/facebook/relay) - Relay is a JavaScript framework for building data-driven React applications.
*   [urql (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/FormidableLabs/urql) - A simple caching GraphQL client for React.
*   [graphql-hooks (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/nearform/graphql-hooks) - Minimal hooks-first GraphQL client with caching and server-side rendering support.
*   [mst-gql (‚≠ê688)](https://github.com/mobxjs/mst-gql) - Bindings for mobx-state-tree and GraphQL.
*   [micro-graphql-react (‚≠ê532)](https://github.com/arackaf/micro-graphql-react) - A lightweight utility for adding GraphQL to React. components. Includes simple caching and uses GET requests that could additionally be cached through a service-worker.

### Servers / React

*   [apollo-server (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-server) - Spec-compliant and production ready JavaScript GraphQL server that lets you develop in a schema-first way. Built for Express, Connect, Hapi, Koa, and more.
*   [hapi-graphql (‚≠ê113)](https://github.com/SimonDegraeve/hapi-graphql) - Create a GraphQL HTTP server with Hapi.
*   [hapi-plugin-graphiql (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/rse/hapi-plugin-graphiql) - HAPI plugin for GraphiQL integration.
*   [graphql-api-koa (‚≠ê52)](https://github.com/jaydenseric/graphql-api-koa) - GraphQL Koa middleware that implements GraphQL.js from scratch and supports native ESM.
*   [koa-graphql (‚≠ê842)](https://github.com/chentsulin/koa-graphql) - GraphQL Koa Middleware.
*   [gql (‚≠ê198)](https://github.com/deno-libs/gql) - Universal GraphQL HTTP middleware for Deno.
*   [mercurius (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/mercurius-js/mercurius) - GraphQL plugin for Fastify.
*   [graphql-yoga (‚≠ê8.4k)](https://github.com/prisma-labs/graphql-yoga) - Fully-featured GraphQL Server with focus on easy setup, performance and great developer experience.
*   [graphitejs (‚≠ê121)](https://github.com/graphitejs/server) - Framework NodeJS for GraphQL.
*   [graphql-helix (‚≠ê829)](https://github.com/contrawork/graphql-helix) - A highly evolved GraphQL HTTP Server.

### Databases & ORMs / React

*   [graphql-sequelize (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/mickhansen/graphql-sequelize) - Sequelize helpers for GraphQL.
*   [graphql-bookshelf (‚≠ê184)](https://github.com/brysgo/graphql-bookshelf) - Some help defining GraphQL schema around BookshelfJS models.
*   [join-monster (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/acarl005/join-monster) - A GraphQL-to-SQL query execution layer for batch data fetching.

### PubSub / React

*   [graphql-ably-pubsub](https://www.npmjs.com/package/graphql-ably-pubsub) - Ably PubSub implementation for GraphQL to publish mutation updates and subscribe to the result through a subscription query.

### Custom Scalars / React

*   [graphql-scalars (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/Urigo/graphql-scalars) - A library of custom GraphQL Scalars for creating precise type-safe GraphQL schemas.
*   [graphql-java-datetime (‚≠ê149)](https://github.com/donbeave/graphql-java-datetime) - GraphQL ISO Date is a set of RFC 3339 compliant date/time scalar types to be used with graphql-java.
*   [graphql-java-extended-scalars (‚≠ê273)](https://github.com/graphql-java/graphql-java-extended-scalars) - Extended scalars for graphql-java.

### Type / React

*   [type-graphql (‚≠ê8.1k)](https://github.com/19majkel94/type-graphql) - Create GraphQL schema and resolvers with TypeScript, using classes and decorators!
*   [graphql-nexus (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/graphql-nexus/nexus) - Code-First, Type-Safe, GraphQL Schema Construction.

### Tools - Miscellaneous / React

*   [graphql-code-generator (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/dotansimha/graphql-code-generator) - GraphQL code generator based on schema and documents.
*   [swagger-to-graphql (‚≠ê923)](https://github.com/yarax/swagger-to-graphql) - GraphQL types builder based on REST API described in Swagger. Allows to migrate to GraphQL from REST for 5 minutes
*   [ts-graphql-plugin (‚≠ê744)](https://github.com/Quramy/ts-graphql-plugin) - A language service plugin complete and validate GraphQL query in TypeScript template strings.
*   [apollo-tracing (‚≠ê479)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-tracing) - GraphQL extension that enables you to easily get resolver-level performance information as part of a GraphQL response.
*   [json-graphql-server (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/marmelab/json-graphql-server) - Get a full fake GraphQL API with zero coding in less than 30 seconds, based on a JSON data file.
*   [Prisma (‚≠ê43k)](https://github.com/prisma/prisma) - Turn your database into a GraphQL API. Prisma lets you design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
*   [tuql (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/bradleyboy/tuql) - Automatically create a GraphQL server from any sqlite database.
*   [Bit (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/teambit/bit) - Organize GraphQL API as components to be consumed with NPM or modified from any project, [example-explanation](https://hackernoon.com/make-your-graphql-api-easier-to-adopt-through-components-74b022f195c1)).
*   [openapi-to-graphql (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/ibm/openapi-to-graphql) - Take any OpenAPI Specification (OAS) or swagger and create a GraphQL interface - Two minute video and resources [here](https://developer.ibm.com/open/projects/openapi-to-graphql/)
*   [Retool](https://retool.com/) ‚Äì Internal tools builder on top of your GraphQL APIs + GraphQL IDE with a schema explorer.
*   [dataloader-codegen (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/Yelp/dataloader-codegen) - An opinionated JavaScript library for automatically generating predictable, type safe DataLoaders over a set of resources (e.g. HTTP endpoints).
*   [raphql-inspector (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/graphql-inspector): alidate schema, get schema change notifications, validate operations, find breaking changes, look for similar types, schema coverage.

### Miscellaneous / React

*   [graphql-tools (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/apollographql/graphql-tools) - Tool library for building and maintaining GraphQL-JS servers.
*   [graphql-tag (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/apollographql/graphql-tag) - A JavaScript template literal tag that parses GraphQL queries.
*   [graphql-compose (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/graphql-compose/graphql-compose) - Tool which allows you to construct flexible graphql schema from different data sources via plugins.
*   [graphql-modules (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/Urigo/graphql-modules) - Separate GraphQL server into smaller, reusable parts by modules or features.
*   [graphql-shield (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/maticzav/graphql-shield) - A library that helps creating a permission layer for a graphql api.
*   [graphql-let (‚≠ê455)](https://github.com/piglovesyou/graphql-let) - A webpack loader to import type-protected codegen results directly from GraphQL documents
*   [graphql-config (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/graphql-config) - One configuration for all your GraphQL tools (supported by most tools, editors & IDEs).
*   [graphql-cli (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/urigo/graphql-cli) - A command line tool for common GraphQL development workflows.
*   [graphql-toolkit (‚≠ê168)](https://github.com/ardatan/graphql-toolkit) - A set of utils for faster development of GraphQL tools (Schema and documents loading, Schema merging and more).
*   [graphql-mesh (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/urigo/graphql-mesh) - use GraphQL query language to access data in remote APIs that don't run GraphQL (and also ones that do run GraphQL).
*   [sofa (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/Urigo/sofa) - Generate REST API from your GraphQL API.
*   [graphback (‚≠ê409)](https://github.com/aerogear/graphback) - Framework and CLI to add a GraphQLCRUD API layer to a GraphQL server using data models.
*   [graphql-middleware (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/maticzav/graphql-middleware) - Split up your GraphQL resolvers in middleware functions.
*   [graphql-relay-js (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-relay-js) - A library to help construct a graphql-js server supporting react-relay.
*   [graphql-normalizr (‚≠ê195)](https://github.com/monojack/graphql-normalizr) - Normalize GraphQL responses for persisting in the client cache/state.
*   [babel-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/ooflorent/babel-plugin-graphql) - Babel plugin that compile GraphQL tagged template strings.
*   [eslint-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/apollographql/eslint-plugin-graphql) - An ESLint plugin that checks your GraphQL strings against a schema.
*   [graphql-ws (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/enisdenjo/graphql-ws) - Coherent, zero-dependency, lazy, simple, GraphQL over WebSocket Protocol compliant server and client.
*   [graphql-live-query (‚≠ê437)](https://github.com/n1ru4l/graphql-live-query) - Realtime GraphQL Live Queries with JavaScript.

### JavaScript Examples / React

*   [React Starter Kit (‚≠ê23k)](https://github.com/kriasoft/react-starter-kit) - front-end starter kit using React, Relay, GraphQL, and JAM stack architecture.
*   [SWAPI GraphQL Wrapper (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/graphql/swapi-graphql) - A GraphQL schema and server wrapping SWAPI.
*   [Relay TodoMVC (‚≠ê158)](https://github.com/taion/relay-todomvc) - Relay TodoMVC with routing.
*   [Apollo Server tools documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/apollo-server/) - Documentation, tutorial and examples for building GraphQL server and connecting to SQL, MongoDB and REST endpoints.
*   [F8 App 2017 (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/fbsamples/f8app) - Source code of the official F8 app of 2016, powered by React Native and other Facebook open source projects.
*   [Apollo React example for Github GraphQL API (‚≠ê114)](https://github.com/katopz/react-apollo-graphql-github-example) - Usage Examples Apollo React for Github GraphQL API with create-react-app.
*   [Next.js TypeScript and GraphQL Example (‚≠ê133k)](https://github.com/zeit/next.js/tree/canary/examples/with-typescript-graphql) - A type-protected GraphQL example on Next.js running [graphql-codegen](https://graphql-code-generator.com/) under the hood
*   [GraphQL StackBlitz Starter](https://stackblitz.com/fork/graphql) ‚Äì A live, editable demo spinning up in about 2 seconds and running in a browser.
*   [NAPERG (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/alan345/naperg) - Fullstack Boilerplate GraphQL. Made with React & Prisma + authentication & roles.
*   [VulcanJS](http://vulcanjs.org) - The full-stack React+GraphQL framework
*   [RAN Toolkit (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/sly777/ran) - Production-ready toolkit/boilerplate with support for GraphQL, SSR, Hot-reload, CSS-in-JS, caching, and more.

### TypeScript Examples / React

*   [Node.js API Starter (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/kriasoft/nodejs-api-starter) - Yarn v2 based monorepo template (code-first GraphQL API, PostgreSQL, PnP, Zero-install, serverless).
*   [Next.js Apollo TypeScript Starter (‚≠ê273)](https://github.com/borisowsky/nextjs-apollo-ts-starter) - Next.js starter project focused on developer experience.
*   [GraphQL Starter (‚≠ê112)](https://github.com/cerino-ligutom/GraphQL-Starter) - A boilerplate for TypeScript + Node Express + Apollo GraphQL APIs.

### Ruby / React

*   [graphql-ruby (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/rmosolgo/graphql-ruby) - Ruby implementation of Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [graphql-batch (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/Shopify/graphql-batch) - A query batching executor for the graphql gem.
*   [graphql-auth (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/o2web/graphql-auth) - A JWT auth wrapper working with devise.
*   [agoo (‚≠ê918)](https://github.com/ohler55/agoo) - Ruby web server that implements Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [GQLi (‚≠ê209)](https://github.com/contentful-labs/gqli.rb) - A GraphQL client and DSL. Allowing to write queries in native Ruby.

### Ruby Examples / React

*   [graphql-ruby-demo (‚≠ê218)](https://github.com/rmosolgo/graphql-ruby-demo) - Use graphql-ruby to expose a Rails app.
*   [github-graphql-rails-example (‚≠ê279)](https://github.com/github/github-graphql-rails-example) - Example Rails app using GitHub's GraphQL API.
*   [relay-on-rails (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/nethsix/relay-on-rails) - Barebones starter kit for Relay application with Rails GraphQL server.
*   [relay-rails-blog (‚≠ê140)](https://github.com/gauravtiwari/relay-rails-blog) - A graphql, relay and standard rails application powered demo weblog.
*   [agoo-demo (‚≠ê918)](https://github.com/ohler55/agoo/tree/develop/example/graphql) - Use of the Agoo server to demonstrate a simple GraphQL application.
*   [rails-devise-graphql (‚≠ê286)](https://github.com/zauberware/rails-devise-graphql) - A rails 6 boilerplate with devise, graphql & JWT auth.

### PHP / React

*   [graphql-php (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/webonyx/graphql-php) - A PHP port of GraphQL reference implementation.
*   [graphql-relay-php (‚≠ê271)](https://github.com/ivome/graphql-relay-php) - Relay helpers for webonyx/graphql-php implementation of GraphQL.
*   [lighthouse (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/nuwave/lighthouse) - A PHP package that allows to serve a GraphQL endpoint from your Laravel application.
*   [graphql-laravel (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/rebing/graphql-laravel) - Laravel wrapper for Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [overblog/graphql-bundle (‚≠ê791)](https://github.com/overblog/GraphQLBundle) - This bundle provides tools to build a complete GraphQL server in your Symfony App. Supports react-relay.
*   [wp-graphql (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/wp-graphql/wp-graphql) - GraphQL API for WordPress.
*   [graphqlite (‚≠ê561)](https://github.com/thecodingmachine/graphqlite) - Framework agnostic library that allows you to write GraphQL server by annotating your PHP classes.
*   [siler (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/leocavalcante/siler) - Plain-old functions providing a declarative API for GraphQL servers with Subscriptions support.
*   [graphql-request-builder (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/dpauli/php-graphql-request-builder) - Builds request payload in GraphQL structure.

### PHP Examples / React

*   [siler-graphgl (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/leocavalcante/siler/tree/main/examples/graphql) - An example GraphQL server written with Siler.

### Python / React

*   [graphql-parser (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/tryolabs/graphql-parser) - GraphQL parser for Python.
*   [graphql-relay-py (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/graphql-python/graphql-relay-py) - A library to help construct a graphql-py server supporting react-relay.
*   [graphql-parser-python (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/tallstreet/graphql-parser-python) - A python wrapper around libgraphqlparser.
*   [graphene (‚≠ê8.2k)](https://github.com/graphql-python/graphene) - A package for creating GraphQL schemas/types in a Pythonic easy way.
*   [graphene-gae (‚≠ê117)](https://github.com/graphql-python/graphene-gae) - Adds GraphQL support to Google AppEngine (GAE).
*   [django-graphiql (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/GraphQL-python-archive/django-graphiql) - Integrate GraphiQL easily into your Django project.
*   [flask-graphql (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/graphql-python/flask-graphql) - Adds GraphQL support to your Flask application.
*   [python-graphql-client (‚≠ê155)](https://github.com/prisma/python-graphql-client) - Simple GraphQL client for Python 2.7+
*   [python-graphjoiner (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/healx/python-graphjoiner) - Create GraphQL APIs using joins, SQL or otherwise.
*   [graphene-django (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/graphql-python/graphene-django) - A Django integration for Graphene.
*   [Flask-GraphQL-Auth (‚≠ê63)](https://github.com/callsign-viper/Flask-GraphQL-Auth) - An authentication library for Flask inspired from flask-jwt-extended.
*   [tartiflette (‚≠ê858)](https://github.com/dailymotion/tartiflette) - GraphQL Implementation, SDL First, for python 3.6+ / asyncio.
*   [tartiflette-aiohttp (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/dailymotion/tartiflette-aiohttp) - Wrapper of Tartiflette to expose GraphQL API over HTTP based on aiohttp / 3.6+ / asyncio, [official tutorial available on tartiflette.io](https://tartiflette.io/docs/tutorial/getting-started).
*   [Ariadne (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/mirumee/ariadne) - library for implementing GraphQL servers using schema-first approach. Asynchronous query execution, batteries included for ASGI, WSGI and popular webframeworks, [fully documented](https://ariadnegraphql.org).
*   [django-graphql-auth (‚≠ê333)](https://github.com/PedroBern/django-graphql-auth) - Django registration and authentication with GraphQL.
*   [strawberry (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/strawberry-graphql/strawberry) - A new GraphQL library for Python.

### Python Examples / React

*   [swapi-graphene (‚≠ê174)](https://github.com/graphql-python/swapi-graphene) - A GraphQL schema and server using [Graphene](https://graphene-python.org).

### Java / React

*   [graphql-java (‚≠ê6.2k)](https://github.com/graphql-java/graphql-java) - GraphQL Java implementation.
*   [DGS Framework (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/Netflix/dgs-framework) - A GraphQL server framework for Spring Boot, developed by Netflix.

Specifications

  • GraphQL (‚≠ê14k) - Working draft of the specification for GraphQL.

  • GraphQL Relay - Relay-compliant GraphQL server specification.
  • OpenCRUD (‚≠ê388) - OpenCRUD is a GraphQL CRUD API specification for databases.

Foundations

  • GraphQL Foundation - GraphQL Foundation under the Linux Foundation

Communities

  • Facebook - Group for discussions, articles and knowledge sharing.
  • StackOverflow - Questions and answers. Use the tag graphql.
  • GraphQL APIs (‚≠ê4.6k) - A collective list of public GraphQL APIs.

Meetups

  • Relay Meetup - A global, online meetup on Relay, the GraphQL client.

JavaScript/TypeScript

  • graphql-js (‚≠ê20k) - A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript.
  • graphql-jit (‚≠ê1.1k) - GraphQL execution using a JIT compiler.

Clients

  • apollo-client (‚≠ê20k) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for every UI framework and GraphQL server.
  • graphql-request (‚≠ê6k) - A minimal GraphQL client for Node and browsers.
  • typescript-graphql-request - Use GraphQL Request as a fully typed SDK.
  • graphql-zeus (‚≠ê2k) - GraphQL Zeus creates autocomplete client library for JavaScript or TypeScript which provides autocompletion for strongly typed queries.
  • graphqurl (‚≠ê3.4k) - curl for GraphQL with autocomplete, subscriptions and GraphiQL. Also a dead-simple universal javascript GraphQL client.
  • aws-amplify (‚≠ê9.5k) - A client library developed by Amazon for caching, analytics and more that includes a way to fetch GraphQL queries.

Frontend Framework Integrations

  • vue-apollo (‚≠ê6.1k) - Apollo/GraphQL integration for VueJS.
  • apollo-angular (‚≠ê1.5k) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for Angular and every GraphQL server.
  • svelte-apollo (‚≠ê949) - Svelte integration for Apollo GraphQL.
  • ember-apollo-client (‚≠ê280) - An ember-cli addon for Apollo Client and GraphQL.
  • apollo-elements (‚≠ê420) - GraphQL web components that work in any frontend framework.

Frontend Framework Integrations / React

  • react-apollo - The core @apollo/client library provides built-in integration with React.
  • relay (‚≠ê19k) - Relay is a JavaScript framework for building data-driven React applications.
  • urql (‚≠ê8.8k) - A simple caching GraphQL client for React.
  • graphql-hooks (‚≠ê1.9k) - Minimal hooks-first GraphQL client with caching and server-side rendering support.
  • mst-gql (‚≠ê688) - Bindings for mobx-state-tree and GraphQL.
  • micro-graphql-react (‚≠ê532) - A lightweight utility for adding GraphQL to React. components. Includes simple caching and uses GET requests that could additionally be cached through a service-worker.

Servers / React

  • apollo-server (‚≠ê14k) - Spec-compliant and production ready JavaScript GraphQL server that lets you develop in a schema-first way. Built for Express, Connect, Hapi, Koa, and more.
  • hapi-graphql (‚≠ê113) - Create a GraphQL HTTP server with Hapi.
  • hapi-plugin-graphiql (‚≠ê21) - HAPI plugin for GraphiQL integration.
  • graphql-api-koa (‚≠ê52) - GraphQL Koa middleware that implements GraphQL.js from scratch and supports native ESM.
  • koa-graphql (‚≠ê842) - GraphQL Koa Middleware.
  • gql (‚≠ê198) - Universal GraphQL HTTP middleware for Deno.
  • mercurius (‚≠ê2.4k) - GraphQL plugin for Fastify.
  • graphql-yoga (‚≠ê8.4k) - Fully-featured GraphQL Server with focus on easy setup, performance and great developer experience.
  • graphitejs (‚≠ê121) - Framework NodeJS for GraphQL.
  • graphql-helix (‚≠ê829) - A highly evolved GraphQL HTTP Server.

Databases & ORMs / React

  • graphql-sequelize (‚≠ê1.9k) - Sequelize helpers for GraphQL.
  • graphql-bookshelf (‚≠ê184) - Some help defining GraphQL schema around BookshelfJS models.
  • join-monster (‚≠ê2.7k) - A GraphQL-to-SQL query execution layer for batch data fetching.

PubSub / React

  • graphql-ably-pubsub - Ably PubSub implementation for GraphQL to publish mutation updates and subscribe to the result through a subscription query.

Custom Scalars / React

  • graphql-scalars (‚≠ê1.9k) - A library of custom GraphQL Scalars for creating precise type-safe GraphQL schemas.
  • graphql-java-datetime (‚≠ê149) - GraphQL ISO Date is a set of RFC 3339 compliant date/time scalar types to be used with graphql-java.
  • graphql-java-extended-scalars (‚≠ê273) - Extended scalars for graphql-java.

Type / React

  • type-graphql (‚≠ê8.1k) - Create GraphQL schema and resolvers with TypeScript, using classes and decorators!
  • graphql-nexus (‚≠ê3.4k) - Code-First, Type-Safe, GraphQL Schema Construction.

Tools - Miscellaneous / React

  • graphql-code-generator (‚≠ê11k) - GraphQL code generator based on schema and documents.
  • swagger-to-graphql (‚≠ê923) - GraphQL types builder based on REST API described in Swagger. Allows to migrate to GraphQL from REST for 5 minutes
  • ts-graphql-plugin (‚≠ê744) - A language service plugin complete and validate GraphQL query in TypeScript template strings.
  • apollo-tracing (‚≠ê479) - GraphQL extension that enables you to easily get resolver-level performance information as part of a GraphQL response.
  • json-graphql-server (‚≠ê1.9k) - Get a full fake GraphQL API with zero coding in less than 30 seconds, based on a JSON data file.
  • Prisma (‚≠ê43k) - Turn your database into a GraphQL API. Prisma lets you design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
  • tuql (‚≠ê1.1k) - Automatically create a GraphQL server from any sqlite database.
  • Bit (‚≠ê18k) - Organize GraphQL API as components to be consumed with NPM or modified from any project, example-explanation).
  • openapi-to-graphql (‚≠ê1.6k) - Take any OpenAPI Specification (OAS) or swagger and create a GraphQL interface - Two minute video and resources here
  • Retool ‚Äì Internal tools builder on top of your GraphQL APIs + GraphQL IDE with a schema explorer.
  • dataloader-codegen (‚≠ê115) - An opinionated JavaScript library for automatically generating predictable, type safe DataLoaders over a set of resources (e.g. HTTP endpoints).
  • raphql-inspector (‚≠ê1.7k): alidate schema, get schema change notifications, validate operations, find breaking changes, look for similar types, schema coverage.

Miscellaneous / React

  • graphql-tools (‚≠ê5.4k) - Tool library for building and maintaining GraphQL-JS servers.
  • graphql-tag (‚≠ê2.3k) - A JavaScript template literal tag that parses GraphQL queries.
  • graphql-compose (‚≠ê1.2k) - Tool which allows you to construct flexible graphql schema from different data sources via plugins.
  • graphql-modules (‚≠ê1.3k) - Separate GraphQL server into smaller, reusable parts by modules or features.
  • graphql-shield (‚≠ê3.6k) - A library that helps creating a permission layer for a graphql api.
  • graphql-let (‚≠ê455) - A webpack loader to import type-protected codegen results directly from GraphQL documents
  • graphql-config (‚≠ê1.2k) - One configuration for all your GraphQL tools (supported by most tools, editors & IDEs).
  • graphql-cli (‚≠ê2k) - A command line tool for common GraphQL development workflows.
  • graphql-toolkit (‚≠ê168) - A set of utils for faster development of GraphQL tools (Schema and documents loading, Schema merging and more).
  • graphql-mesh (‚≠ê3.4k) - use GraphQL query language to access data in remote APIs that don't run GraphQL (and also ones that do run GraphQL).
  • sofa (‚≠ê1.1k) - Generate REST API from your GraphQL API.
  • graphback (‚≠ê409) - Framework and CLI to add a GraphQLCRUD API layer to a GraphQL server using data models.
  • graphql-middleware (‚≠ê1.1k) - Split up your GraphQL resolvers in middleware functions.
  • graphql-relay-js (‚≠ê1.5k) - A library to help construct a graphql-js server supporting react-relay.
  • graphql-normalizr (‚≠ê195) - Normalize GraphQL responses for persisting in the client cache/state.
  • babel-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê64) - Babel plugin that compile GraphQL tagged template strings.
  • eslint-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê1.2k) - An ESLint plugin that checks your GraphQL strings against a schema.
  • graphql-ws (‚≠ê1.8k) - Coherent, zero-dependency, lazy, simple, GraphQL over WebSocket Protocol compliant server and client.
  • graphql-live-query (‚≠ê437) - Realtime GraphQL Live Queries with JavaScript.

JavaScript Examples / React
